edge: A movie is presented in this context, and its summary is provided. The summary provides a brief overview of the movie's plot, characters, and other important aspects.
Gotti is a biographical crime film about the life of John Gotti, portrayed by John Travolta in the movie.
In the film, Victoria is played by Kelly Preston and portrays John Gotti's wife.
John Gotti was a notorious New York City mobster, and the film depicts his criminal activities.
Initially, Barry Levinson was set to direct the film, but he left the project due to creative differences.
Al Pacino was previously cast as John Gotti in the movie, before being replaced by John Travolta.
In 1973, Aniello "Neil" Dellacroce tasks Gotti, a young associate, with killing gangster James McBratney, who is believed to have kidnapped and murdered boss Carlo Gambino's nephew Emanuel.

After executing McBratney at a bar, Gotti is identified as his killer in 1974 and sentenced to 4 years at Green Haven Correctional Facility the following year; due to the Gambino family's influence, however, he is released on "medical furloughs"

He is identified as his killer in 1974 and sentenced to 4 years at Green Haven Correctional Facility the following year; due to the Gambino family's influence, however, he is released on "medical furloughs" both for appointments with the family's dentist and for conducting further criminal business, including another hit.
Gotti operates out of the Bergin Hunt and Fish Club with his childhood friend Angelo Ruggiero. His oldest son John "Junior" Gotti enters the New York Military Academy, but aspires to join the Mafia.
In 1973, Aniello "Neil" Dellacroce tasks Gotti, a young associate, with killing gangster James McBratney, who is believed to have kidnapped and murdered boss Carlo Gambino's nephew Emanuel.
Despite Dellacroce's counsel and the assurances of fellow capo Frank DeCicco, Gotti mistrusts the Lucchese crime family's top underboss, Anthony Casso.
Despite Dellacroce's counsel and the assurances of fellow capo Frank DeCicco, Gotti mistrusts the Lucchese crime family's top underboss, Anthony Casso.
Reunites with his wife Victoria and children at their new residence in Howard Beach, Queens, and becomes a "made man", immediately climbing the Mafia hierarchy to become a capo.

Gotti fails to attend Dellacroce's funeral two days after his death on December 2.

Gottí takes over the Gambino family, becoming 'the real-life Godfather' after Castellano and his bodyguard Thomas Bilotti are gunned down outside Sparks Steak House in midtown Manhattan, on December 16.
Rival boss Vincent 'The Chin' Gigante of the Genovese crime family plots with Casso to eliminate Gottí.
DeCicco is killed by a car bomb that Ruggiero believes was meant for Gotti on April 13, 1986.
Casso tracks down and tortures the hitman James Hydell into revealing he was sent by Ruggiero.
Gotti reconciles with Gigante before excommunicating Ruggiero from his crew to shield him from further retribution.
Underboss Salvatore 'Sammy the Bull' Gravano testifies against Gotti, leading to his conviction and imprisonment in 1992.
Junior is inducted into the Gambino family on Christmas Eve 1988.
Junior marries his wife Kim in April 1990.
Several family members are killed as rivals target the organization after Junior assumes control.
father-son relationship, Junior follows in his father's criminal footsteps but eventually abandons it for his family's sake after Gotti Sr.'s death from throat cancer

node_2: united states medical center for federal prisoners
edge: Junior visits his ailing father at this prison in Missouri to inform him of his plea bargain consideration
Gotti Sr. Dies from this illness in 2002
Junior is released from prison after going through five trials

The film Gotti had a limited release.
The film Gotti grossed $4.3 million in the United States.
Gotti began its limited release in 503 theaters.
In its opening weekend, Gotti made $1.7 million at the box office.
After failing to secure a wide release through Lionsgate Premiere, distributors Vertical Entertainment picked up Gotti for wider distribution.
Gotti was originally scheduled to be released in a limited release and through video on demand on December 15, 2017.

node_1: ohio's revised motion picture tax credit
edge: Some scenes of Gotti were filmed in Brooklyn on February 21, 2017, as part of Ohio's revised Motion Picture Tax Credit.

The film Gotti on Rotten Tomatoes has an approval rating of 0% based on 58 reviews, with an average rating of 2.2/10, according to their website.
According to Metacritic, the film Gotti has a weighted average score of 24 out of 100 based on reviews from 16 critics, indicating 'generally unfavorable reviews'.

movie 'Gotti' validates criticism that mob movies invariably glorify their subjects, as the film does its best to make Gotti come off as a noble and ruthless warrior-leader who only killed his own and kept a lid on neighborhood crime.
the fact that it mostly portrays John Gotti as a loving family man is a first in the history of the genre, according to the given context.

the fact that it mostly portrays John Gotti as a loving family man and altogether likable guy, and his son John Gotti Jr. As a victim of government persecution, may be a first in the history of the genre.

'Listen to me, and listen to me good. You never gonna see another guy like me if you live to be five thousand,' Travolta's Teflon Don boasts in the final scene of the movie 'Gotti'. With any luck, we'll never see another mob-movie misfire like this either,' according to Nick Schager's review.
'the worst mob movie of all-time' - according to Johnny Oleksinski's review in the New York Post

The large disparity between the audience approval score and critics' score on Rotten Tomatoes during the film's opening weekend, which led to accusations of vote manipulation against the production studio and marketing team.
The campaign proclaimed by the production studio and marketing team asking consumers to ignore the 'trolls behind a keyboard' and trust the people, in response to the criticism from the critics.
It was noted that 32 of the 54 written reviews for 'Gotti' were found to be from first-time reviewers on the site, who had also only left a review for 'Gotti' itself.

MoviePass is the company responsible for distributing and marketing the film Gotti through its subsidiary MoviePass Ventures.
Of the 54 written reviews for Gotti, 32 were found to be from first-time reviewers on the site. These accounts also only left a review for Gotti itself.
A total of 54 written reviews were found for the film Gotti on the site.
Many of the accounts that left reviews for Gotti also wrote a review for American Animals, which along with Gotti are the only films owned by MoviePass through its company MoviePass Ventures.
Additionally, 45 of the accounts created to leave reviews for Gotti were also first-time reviewers on the site and created their account in the same month.
The praised American Animals is also owned by MoviePass Ventures.
MoviePass's business model of offering unlimited movies is responsible for 40% of the tickets sold.
